intro: Anagallis tenella f. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered mouse-eared chickweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It is a low-growing perennial that produces small, white flowers with five petals. The plant has hairy, succulent leaves and thrives in rocky or sandy soils. It blooms from spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees. This variety is distinguished by its pale, almost white floral color compared to the typical pink or red of the species.
